wikipedia_page.main: Rowland Clegg-Hill, 3rd Viscount Hill (5 December 1833 – 30 March 1895), known as Rowland Hill until 1872, was a British Conservative politician.

response: * Rowland Clegg-Hill, 3rd Viscount Hill (1833–1895), British peer
*Rowland Clegg-Hill, 3rd Viscount Hill (1833–1895) slide to bankruptcy of Hawkstone Park
*Hon. Isabella Elizabeth Wynn (d. 29 July 1898) married Rowland Clegg-Hill, 3rd Viscount Hill in 1876

Having retired from the Royal Horse Guards in April 1864, Hill was appointed a deputy lieutenant of Shropshire in 1865. He was promoted to captain in July 1867, at which point he was serving with the 1st Shropshire Artillery Volunteer Corps, with promotion to major following in May 1869. Hill resigned his commission in December 1875. He was also a justice of the peace for Shropshire. Hill died following a short illness in May 1891 at his residence near Llandeilo in Wales.Notes and News. Tenbury Wells Advertiser. 12 May 1891. p. 5 His elder brother was the politician Rowland Clegg-Hill, 3rd Viscount Hill.
